questions.questionHtml: The largest moon in our solar system has an atmosphere that is denser than the atmosphere of Mars. The name of this moon is:
Place a checkmark beside the Gas Giant planets.
questions.feedbackForPerfect: Correct! The rocky planets are Earth, Mercury, Venus, and Mars. Jupiter, Neptune, Saturn, and Uranus are all gas giants.
questions.feedbackForImperfect: The rocky planets are Earth, Mercury, Venus, and Mars. Jupiter, Neptune, Saturn, and Uranus are all gas giants.

questions.questionHtml:
Rank the below planets in order of their size, starting with the smallest.
The smallest planet should be number 1.
questions.hintHtml: Jupiter is the biggest planet! So it should be number 4.
questions.feedbackForPerfect:
Correct!

The order, from smallest to largest, is 1. Uranus, 2. Neptune, 3. Saturn, 4. Jupiter. Jupiter is the biggest!
questions.feedbackForImperfect:
That's the wrong order...

The order, from smallest to largest, is 1. Uranus, 2. Neptune, 3. Saturn, 4. Jupiter. Jupiter is the biggest!
